description.plain: Lizzy McAlpine (b. September 21, 1999) is a vocalist, songwriter, and musician who hails just outside of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. She studied songwriting at the prestigious music-oriented Berklee College of Music in Boston, Massachusetts for two years, but later decided to withdraw from the college after her success. Influenced by an eclectic group of artists such as John Mayer, Bruno Major, dodie and H.E.R.—among others—Lizzy blends folk/acoustic, R&B and indie-pop together to create her own unique style.

body.plain: Lizzy McAlpine (b. September 21, 1999) is a vocalist, songwriter, and musician who hails just outside of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. She studied songwriting at the prestigious music-oriented Berklee College of Music in Boston, Massachusetts for two years, but later decided to withdraw from the college after her success. Influenced by an eclectic group of artists such as John Mayer, Bruno Major, dodie and H.E.R.—among others—Lizzy blends folk/acoustic, R&B and indie-pop together to create her own unique style.

songs.title: ​ceilings

description.plain:
“ceilings” is the eighth track on Lizzy McAlpine’s second album, five seconds flat. The track was performed previous to the album’s release during her tour with English musician dodie, where Lizzy served as the opening act.

Lyrically, the song finds the singer-songwriter daydreaming about someone at the end of a date. In an interview for People, McAlpine revealed “ceilings” is a nostalgic reminiscence of a past relationship.

I had just ended things with someone and then went to London for three months to … not escape that [relationship], but also, kind of, do that. And this song is basically just a reflection on that relationship — but not being in it anymore.

songs.embed_content: Read “​ceilings” by Lizzy McAlpine on Genius
songs.recording_location: Ehren's (Eugene, OR) & The Laundry Pile (Los Angeles, CA)

Lyrically, the song finds the singer-songwriter daydreaming about someone at the end of a date. In an interview for People, McAlpine revealed “ceilings” is a nostalgic reminiscence of a past relationship.

I had just ended things with someone and then went to London for three months to … not escape that [relationship], but also, kind of, do that. And this song is basically just a reflection on that relationship — but not being in it anymore.

songs.lyrics:
34 ContributorsTranslationsEspañol​ceilings Lyrics[Verse 1]
Ceilings, plaster
Can't you just make it move faster?
Lovely to be sitting here with you
You're kinda cute but it's raining harder
My shoes are now full of water
Lovely to be rained on with you
It's kinda cute but it's so short

[Chorus]
Then you're driving me home
And I don't wanna leave
But I have to go
You kiss me in your car
And it feels like the start of a movie I've seen before
Before

[Verse 2]
Bed sheets, no clothes
Touch me like nobody else does
Lovely to just lay here with you
You're kinda cute and I would say all of this
But I don't wanna ruin the moment
Lovely to sit between comfort and chaos

[Chorus]
But it's over
Then you're driving me home
And it kinda comes out as I get up to go
You kiss me in your car
And it feels like the start of a movie I've seen before
You might also like[Outro]
But it's not real
And you don't exist
And I can't recall the last time I was kissed
It hits me in the car
And it feels like the end of a movie I've seen before
Before3Embed

songs.title: ​doomsday

description.plain:
Released as a single following Lizzy McAlpine’s 2021 EP, When The World Stopped Moving, “doomsday” is a departure — the inevitability of death and its acceptance as part of life. In other words, the end of a love for which Lizzy is planning her own funeral and that of a person she once loved.

The song was released alongside a Gus Black directed music video, for which Lizzy wrote the script.

songs.embed_content: Read “​doomsday” by Lizzy McAlpine on Genius

[Verse 2]
Pull the plug, but be carеful

If you'd have stuck around
I feel more free than I have in years

[Chorus]

songs.title: Ruined (Demo)

description.plain:
“Ruined” originates from a short, 32-second demo from Lizzy’s TikTok, posted on June 24, 2020, that hasn’t been officially released.

https://vm.tiktok.com/JjUvo9f/

On January 10, 2021, Lizzy performed a full acoustic version on her Instagram Live and explains why she hasn’t released it.

The unconfirmed bridge was performed on an Instagram Live on July 10, 2020 that was reposted by a fan account.
